trans-unit.source: Open the Android SDK Manager by clicking **Window** from the top toolbar of Eclipse.
trans-unit.target: Open the Android SDK Manager by clicking **Window** from the top toolbar of Eclipse.

trans-unit.source: Locate the target version of the Android SDK that is specified in your project properties, open it, and choose **Google APIs**.
trans-unit.target: Locate the target version of the Android SDK that is specified in your project properties, open it, and choose **Google APIs**.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to **Extras**, expand it, and choose **Google Play Services**, as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to **Extras**, expand it, and choose **Google Play Services**, as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Note the SDK path, for use in the following step.
trans-unit.target: Note the SDK path, for use in the following step.

trans-unit.source: Install the Google Play Services SDK in your project.
trans-unit.target: Install the Google Play Services SDK in your project.

trans-unit.source: Select **Android**, then **Existing Android Code into Workspace**, and click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Android**, then **Existing Android Code into Workspace**, and click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Browse**, navigate to the Android SDK path (usually in a folder named `adt-bundle-windows-x86_64` inside the folder that contains Eclipse), then go to the `\extras\google\google_play_services\libproject` subfolder, and there select the google-play-services-lib folder, and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Browse**, navigate to the Android SDK path (usually in a folder named `adt-bundle-windows-x86_64` inside the folder that contains Eclipse), then go to the `\extras\google\google_play_services\libproject` subfolder, and there select the google-play-services-lib folder, and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Check the **Copy projects into workspace** checkbox, and then click **Finish**.
trans-unit.target: Check the **Copy projects into workspace** checkbox, and then click **Finish**.

trans-unit.source: Next you must reference the Google Play Services SDK library that you just imported, from your project.
trans-unit.target: Next you must reference the Google Play Services SDK library that you just imported, from your project.

trans-unit.source: In **Package Explorer**, right-click your project and choose *Properties*.
trans-unit.target: In **Package Explorer**, right-click your project and choose *Properties*.

trans-unit.source: In the Properties window, choose Android on the left.
trans-unit.target: In the Properties window, choose Android on the left.

trans-unit.source: Under **Project Build Target**, ensure that `Google APIs x86` (or `Google APIs`, depending on your development platform) is selected for the appropriate SDK level.
trans-unit.target: Under **Project Build Target**, ensure that `Google APIs x86` (or `Google APIs`, depending on your development platform) is selected for the appropriate SDK level.

trans-unit.source: In the **Library** section, choose **Add** , and select the Google Play Services project (*google-play-services-lib*) and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Library** section, choose **Add** , and select the Google Play Services project (*google-play-services-lib*) and click **OK**.
